skdetail:
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: my home support
Developer Terms of Use
des:
My Home Support skill will help you organize your daily routines so you will never forget an appointment, to take a medication or to be active.

To use this skill, you must have an Amazon account to be able to query your daily routines by the event name.

We will ONLY share this information with you or with My Home Support App if you have created an account with My Home Support App. We will NOT use this information for other purpose such as advertisement or analytics.

Also, to use this skill, you must give the following permissions requested by this skill when you enable the skill from the Alexa App:
. Reminders to set up your daily routines so you could query them later by the event name.
. Notifications so My Home Support App could send you suggested daily routines.

After you open the skill by saying:
“Alexa, open My Home Support”

Alexa, will prompt you with things you could ask:
“How may I make your Sunday morning better? Say, what is next, record or remind me.

You could respond back by saying:
“Remind me my doctor appointment tomorrow at 1:00 PM”
“Remind me to walk 10 steps every day at 8:00 AM”
“Record walk routine 10 steps”
“Record doctor appointment”
“What is next”
“When is my next doctor appointment”

Optional, Alexa will prompt you to enter a note:
“If you want to add a note, say add note.”

We have a list of routines or tasks that will help you to add to your daily routine like walk, meditate, read, doctor appointment, and much more.

By using My Home Support skill you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy and expressly disclaims that:
This tool does not provide medical advice, and is for informational and educational purposes only, and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, treatment or diagnosis. Call your doctor to receive medical advice. If you think you may have a medical emergency, please dial your local emergency response phone number.
